intro: Sparganium eurycarpum subsp. eurycarpum, commonly known as the broad-fruited bur reed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and shallow waters in Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Typhaceae and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and distinctive, spiky, brownish-purple inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spikelets, which are often submerged or floating on the water surface. Its fruiting structures, known as "burrs," are covered in stiff, bristly hairs and contain numerous small seeds. This species is often found in marshy areas and is an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
